title: 112_hr4265
content: The "Shared Responsibility in Preserving America's Future Act" includes a provision for a surtax on millionaires contingent on the passage of a balanced budget amendment or spending limit amendment. This surtax would be added to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Shared Responsibility in Preserving America's Future Act" includes a provision for a surtax on taxpayers with modified adjusted gross income exceeding $1,000,000, starting after 2012 and before 2023. The surtax is 5% of the income exceeding the threshold amount. Inflation adjustment for taxable years after 2013 increases the $1,000,000 threshold by the cost-of-living adjustment determined for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins. The threshold amount for taxable years after 2013 is adjusted for inflation based on the calendar year in which the taxable year begins. If the adjusted amount is not a multiple of $10,000, it is rounded up to the next highest multiple. For married individuals filing separately, the threshold amount is half of the amount for the taxable year. The threshold amount for taxable years after 2013 is adjusted for inflation based on the calendar year. For married individuals filing separately, the threshold amount is half of the amount for the taxable year. Modified adjusted gross income is calculated by reducing adjusted gross income by the excess of gross income from a trade or business. The definition of 'income' is adjusted gross income minus gross income from a non-passive trade or business where the taxpayer pays wages to at least one full-time equivalent employee. The IRS regulations define income for taxpayers with employees, excluding the taxpayer themselves, and specify deductions properly allocable to that income. Special rules apply for nonresident alien individuals. Special rules apply for determining the income taken into account for nonresident alien individuals and citizens/residents living abroad. The amount under subsection (a) is reduced by the excess of amounts excluded from gross income under section 911 over deductions disallowed under section 911(d)(6). Subsection (a) does not apply to charitable trusts with interests devoted to specific purposes under section 170(c)(2)(B). Charitable trusts with interests devoted to specific purposes under section 170(c)(2)(B) are exempt from the tax imposed in this section. The tax is not considered for determining credits or under section 55. Application of this section is contingent on a Balanced Budget or Spending Limit Amendment. The tax imposed under this section is not considered for determining credits or under section 55. Application of this section is contingent on a Balanced Budget or Spending Limit Amendment. The section pertains to the ratification of proposed amendments to the Constitution of the United States regarding a balanced budget or spending limit. If the President does not certify the amendment before September 30, 2012, it will not apply. This section will not apply to taxable years after December 31, 2017, unless the amendment is ratified. The section deals with ratification of proposed amendments to the Constitution of the United States regarding a balanced budget or spending limit. If the President does not certify the amendment before September 30, 2012, it will not apply. This section will not apply to taxable years after December 31, 2017, unless the amendment is ratified. A clerical amendment is made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendment on the surtax for millionaires will not be considered a change in tax rate under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The effective date for these amendments is for taxable years starting after December 31, 2012.
